Easy Chicken Stir-Fry

Jump to Recipe

Looking for a quick and delicious dinner option? This Easy Chicken Stir-Fry recipe is the answer to your weeknight meal dilemmas! Packed with vibrant vegetables and tender sliced chicken breast, this stir-fry is not only a feast for the eyes but also a wholesome, nutritious choice for your family. The simplicity of the ingredients—like bell peppers, broccoli, and carrots—combined with the savory notes of garlic and soy sauce, makes this dish a delightful balance of flavor and texture. Perfect for those busy evenings, this recipe can be prepared in under 30 minutes, making it an ideal choice for anyone seeking a healthy yet satisfying meal. Plus, it’s easily customizable, allowing you to incorporate your favorite vegetables or proteins. Join us as we guide you through making this delightful Easy Chicken Stir-Fry that the whole family will love!

Ingredients

chicken breast (sliced)

For a more tender texture, consider marinating the chicken in soy sauce, a bit of sesame oil, and cornstarch for about 30 minutes before cooking. If you need a substitute, you can use turkey breast or firm tofu for a vegetarian option.

bell pepper (sliced)

Choose a bell pepper based on your flavor preference; red and yellow are sweeter, while green is more bitter. You can substitute with other colorful vegetables like zucchini or snap peas for added nutrition.

broccoli florets

To keep broccoli vibrant and crisp, blanch the florets in boiling water for 2 minutes before adding them to the stir-fry. If you don't have broccoli, cauliflower or green beans make great substitutes.

carrot (sliced)

For a sweeter flavor, use baby carrots or julienned carrots. You can also substitute with parsnips or thinly sliced radishes for a different taste.

soy sauce

For a gluten-free version, use tamari sauce. If you want a little more depth, consider adding a splash of oyster sauce or hoisin sauce. Always taste before adding salt, as soy sauce is naturally salty.

garlic (minced)

Fresh garlic provides the best flavor, but you can substitute with garlic powder (1/4 teaspoon per clove). For a milder taste, sauté the garlic for a shorter time or add it later in the cooking process.

olive oil

While olive oil is a healthy option, you can also use sesame oil for an authentic Asian flavor. If you're looking for a higher smoke point, canola or peanut oil works well in stir-frying.

salt

Use salt sparingly, especially since soy sauce is also salty. You can replace table salt with sea salt or kosher salt for a different texture.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper will enhance flavor more than pre-ground. For a twist, try adding white pepper for a different heat profile.

rice (cooked, for serving)

Use jasmine or basmati rice for a fragrant pairing, or substitute with quinoa or cauliflower rice for a lower-carb option. Rinse rice before cooking to remove excess starch for fluffier results.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Heat Olive Oil

    In a large pan or wok, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat. Ensure the oil is hot enough before adding other ingredients to prevent sticking.

  • Step 2: Sauté Garlic

    Add 2 cloves of minced garlic to the pan. Stir-fry for about 30 seconds until the garlic is fragrant but not browned, as burnt garlic can impart a bitter taste.

  • Step 3: Cook Chicken Breast

    Add 1 pound of sliced chicken breast to the pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring frequently, until the chicken is browned and cooked through. It's important to ensure the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°F.

  • Step 4: Add Vegetables

    Incorporate 1 sliced bell pepper, 1 cup of broccoli florets, and 1 sliced carrot into the pan. Stir-fry for another 5 minutes, ensuring the vegetables remain tender-crisp (not mushy). This will help retain their nutrients and vibrant colors.

  • Step 5: Add Soy Sauce

    Pour in 3 tablespoons of soy sauce, stirring well to combine all the ingredients. Allow it to cook for an additional 2 minutes to let the flavors meld together.

  • Step 6: Serve

    Serve the chicken stir-fry hot over 2 cups of cooked rice. You can garnish with sesame seeds or green onions if desired for added flavor and presentation.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to slice chicken breast?

Use a sharp knife and slice against the grain to ensure tender pieces. It's easier to slice if the chicken is slightly frozen or chilled.

How do I know when chicken is fully cooked?

Chicken should reach an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). You can check this with a meat thermometer. Alternatively, cut into the thickest part; it should be opaque and juices should run clear.

What if I don't have all the vegetables listed?

No worries! You can substitute with other vegetables like snap peas, zucchini, or mushrooms. Just ensure they are cut into similar sizes for even cooking.

How do I ensure my vegetables are tender but still crisp?

Stir-fry the vegetables over high heat, and avoid overcooking them. Cook just until they are vibrant in color and slightly tender, about 3-5 minutes.

What can I use instead of soy sauce?

If you need a gluten-free option, try tamari. For a lower sodium option, look for low-sodium soy sauce. You can also use coconut aminos for a different flavor.

How can I make my stir-fry more flavorful?

Consider adding a pinch of sugar or a splash of vinegar for balance. You can also include ginger or sesame oil for an extra flavor boost.

What type of pan is best for stir-frying?

A wok is ideal for stir-frying because of its shape, but a large, heavy-bottomed skillet works well too. Just ensure it has enough surface area to cook the ingredients quickly.

How do I safely handle raw chicken?

Always wash your hands before and after handling raw chicken. Use separate cutting boards and utensils for raw chicken to avoid cross-contamination.

Can I prep ingredients ahead of time?

Absolutely! You can slice the chicken and vegetables ahead of time and store them in the refrigerator. This saves time and makes cooking easier.

What should I serve with my stir-fry?

Serving it over rice is classic, but you can also use quinoa, noodles, or even cauliflower rice for a low-carb option.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This stir-fry is naturally gluten-free if you use tamari instead of regular soy sauce. For a low-carb option, serve the stir-fry over cauliflower rice instead of regular rice. If you're looking for a vegetarian alternative, substitute the chicken with tofu or tempeh and increase the amount of vegetables for a hearty meal.

Pairings

For a complete meal experience, consider serving the Easy Chicken Stir-Fry with a side of steamed dumplings or vegetable spring rolls. A light, crisp white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a refreshing iced green tea would complement the dish beautifully. If you prefer a non-alcoholic option, a sparkling water with a hint of lime can enhance the flavors.

Serving Suggestions

To enhance the dining experience, serve the stir-fry in a large, shallow bowl to showcase the colorful ingredients. Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions for added flavor and presentation. For a touch of heat, provide chili flakes or a spicy dipping sauce on the side. Consider offering chopsticks alongside traditional cutlery to add an authentic touch.

Easy Chicken Stir-Fry

25 min
$12.99
400 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

Soy

Dietary Tags:

High ProteinLow Carb

Cuisine:

AsianChinese

Course:

Main Dish

Tags:

QuickHealthyOne-PanEasy

Description

A quick and colorful chicken stir-fry loaded with vegetables and a savory sauce, perfect for a weeknight dinner!

Ingredients

  • chicken breast (sliced): 1 pound
  • bell pepper (sliced): 1
  • broccoli florets: 1 cup
  • carrot (sliced): 1
  • soy sauce: 3 tablespoons
  • garlic (minced): 2 cloves
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • rice (cooked, for serving): 2 cups

Date Created:

11/17/2024
